body:
**Linux:**
```
1/3 Test #423: test/grdgdal/gdal_nn.sh ..........***Failed    0.51 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 22582
malloc(): memory corruption
gmtest: line 57: 22635 Aborted                 (core dumped) "$@"
ERROR: gmtest:61
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1

2/3 Test #517: test/greenspline/gspline_4.sh ....***Failed    0.72 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 22586
grdcontour [WARNING]: No contours within specified -L range
gawk: fatal: cannot open file `dump' for reading (No such file or directory)
ERROR: gspline_4.sh:27
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1
```

**macOS**
```
1/3 Test #229: test/api/apicubeplot.sh ...........***Failed    0.32 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 48711
gmtest: line 57: 48762 Abort trap: 6           "$@"
ERROR: gmtest:57
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1

2/3 Test #454: test/grdinterpolate/onelayer.sh ...***Failed    0.39 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 48713
grdinterpolate [ERROR]: Grid x increment <= 0.0
grdinterpolate [ERROR]: Grid y increment <= 0.0
grdinterpolate (gmtapi_init_grdheader): Please select compatible -R and -I values
grdcontour [WARNING]: Grid has wrong registration type. Switching from gridline to pixel registration
Assertion failed: ((wesn[XLO]+GMT_CONV4_LIMIT*header->inc[GMT_X]) >= header->wesn[XLO] && (wesn[XHI]-GMT_CONV4_LIMIT*header->inc[GMT_X]) <= header->wesn[XHI]), function gmtnc_grd_prep_io, file ../src/gmt_nc.c, line 1373.
gmtest: line 57: 48763 Abort trap: 6           "$@"
ERROR: gmtest:57
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1
```

**Windows**:
```

4/9 Test #517: test/greenspline/gspline_4.sh .....***Failed    7.89 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 42283
grdcontour [WARNING]: No contours within specified -L range
gawk: fatal: cannot open file `dump' for reading (No such file or directory)
ERROR: gspline_4.sh:27
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1
```

comments_content.body: OK, hopefully I can reproduce any of these... my tests pass.  The down-stream message come after something fails so they are not the key thing.   gdal_nn.hs almost always crashes when I run tests in parallel but passes when I run it separately.

BTW, I also get some warnings during compilation:
```
../../src/gmt_api.c:5326:20: warning: unused variable 'new' [-Wunused-variable]
        bool done = true, new = false;
                          ^
../../src/gmt_api.c:5327:27: warning: unused variable 'layer' [-Wunused-variable]
        uint64_t row, col, kol, layer, row_out, i0, i1, j0, j1, k0, k1, ij, ij_orig;
                                ^
../../src/gmt_api.c:5329:9: warning: unused variable 'size' [-Wunused-variable]
        size_t size;
               ^
../../src/gmt_api.c:5834:20: warning: unused variable 'row_by_row' [-Wunused-variable]
        bool done = true, row_by_row;
                          ^
../../src/gmt_api.c:6011:63: warning: variable 'here' is uninitialized when used here [-Wuninitialized]
                                        api_put_val (&(M_obj->data), ij, (double)U_obj->data[ijp+here]);
                                                                                                 ^~~~
../../src/gmt_api.c:5837:33: note: initialize the variable 'here' to silence this warning
        uint64_t k, n_layers_used, here, save_n_bands;
                                       ^
                                        = 0
5 warnings generated.
[90/263] Building C object src/CMakeFiles/gmtlib.dir/gmt_grdio.c.o
../../src/gmt_grdio.c:2542:92: warning: unused parameter 'start' [-Wunused-parameter]
GMT_LOCAL void gmtgrdio_pad_cube_off_sub (struct GMT_GRID *G, gmt_grdfloat *data, uint64_t start) {
                                                                                           ^
../../src/gmt_grdio.c:2542:16: warning: unused function 'gmtgrdio_pad_cube_off_sub' [-Wunused-function]
GMT_LOCAL void gmtgrdio_pad_cube_off_sub (struct GMT_GRID *G, gmt_grdfloat *data, uint64_t start) {
               ^
2 warnings generated.
[111/263] Building C object src/CMakeFiles/gmtlib.dir/gmt_support.c.o
../../src/gmt_support.c:12644:77: warning: unused parameter 'direction' [-Wunused-parameter]
int gmt_cube_BC_set (struct GMT_CTRL *GMT, struct GMT_CUBE *U, unsigned int direction) {
                                                                            ^
1 warning generated.
[171/263] Building C object src/CMakeFiles/gmtlib.dir/greenspline.c.o
../../src/greenspline.c:1441:8: warning: unused variable 'this_env' [-Wunused-variable]
        char *this_env = NULL;
              ^
1 warning generated.
```

I certainly get this for testapi_cube:

```
testapi_cube
test (gmt_grdio.c:3403(gmtlib_free_cube_ptr)): Wrongly tries to free item
test [WARNING]: Max total memory allocated was 84.820 kb [86856 bytes]
test [WARNING]: Single largest allocation was 68.906 kb [70560 bytes]
test [WARNING]: MEMORY NOT FREED: 1.648 kb [1688 bytes]
test [WARNING]: Items allocated: 145 reallocated: 7 freed: 142
test [WARNING]: Items NOT PROPERLY FREED: 3
test [WARNING]: Memory not freed first allocated in gmt_grdio.c:2680(gmt_get_grid) (ID = 100): 0.039 kb [40 bytes]
test [WARNING]: Memory not freed first allocated in gmt_grdio.c:2681(gmt_get_grid) (ID = 101): 0.031 kb [32 bytes]
test [WARNING]: Memory not freed first allocated in gmt_api.c:2212(gmt_get_header) (ID = 102): 0.977 kb [1000 bytes]
test [WARNING]: Memory not freed first allocated in gmt_api.c:2213(gmt_get_header) (ID = 103): 0.602 kb [616 bytes]
```

so that is a start for fixing things.
So @meghanrjones still has onelayer.sh failing after my fixes - still true in the CI, @seisman?  I am unable to reproduce, which is odd since we both run macos.
It passes for me too. Need to wait for the scheduled CI jobs tonight.

Still crashes:
```
2/2 Test #454: test/grdinterpolate/onelayer.sh ...***Failed    0.30 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 48710
grdinterpolate [ERROR]: Grid x increment <= 0.0
grdinterpolate [ERROR]: Grid y increment <= 0.0
grdinterpolate (gmtapi_init_grdheader): Please select compatible -R and -I values
grdinterpolate (gmtlib_make_equidistant_array): Could not reallocate memory [68719476736.00 Gb, 9223372036854775808 items of 8 bytes]
ERROR: Caught signal number 11 (Segmentation fault: 11) at
0   libgmt.6.dylib                      0x000000010bacd3ab gmtlib_make_equidistant_array + 827
1   ???                                 0x0000000000000000 0x0 + 0
Stack backtrace:
0   libgmt.6.dylib                      0x000000010b714aa7 sig_handler + 935
1   libsystem_platform.dylib            0x00007fff737c75fd _sigtramp + 29
2   ???                                 0x6165686472675f74 0x0 + 7018130374952181620

4   libgmt.6.dylib                      0x000000010c0cd000 GMT_grdinterpolate + 32816
5   libgmt.6.dylib                      0x000000010b798269 GMT_Call_Module + 4137
6   gmt                                 0x000000010b6f863f main + 2879
7   libdyld.dylib                       0x00007fff735cacc9 start + 1
8   ???                                 0x0000000000000005 0x0 + 5
ERROR: gmtest:57
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1
```
I see a way this can happen now, thanks.  Fix will be added to the uncommitted _jp2-esri-confusio_n branch.
FYI, all tests pass on macOS CI, but `test/greenspline/gspline_4.sh` still fails on Linux and Windows.
Any tracelog or similar output from those platforms that give any hints of what type of failure?

This is what I can see:
```
2/3 Test #517: test/greenspline/gspline_4.sh ....***Failed    0.70 sec
Set GMT_SESSION_NAME = 22371
grdcontour [WARNING]: No contours within specified -L range
gawk: fatal: cannot open file `dump' for reading (No such file or directory)
ERROR: gspline_4.sh:27
memtrack errors: 0
exit status: 1
```
I am not able to reproduce the gspline_4.sh failure on Linux.

```
exit status: 1


0% tests passed, 1 tests failed out of 1

	517 - test/greenspline/gspline_4.sh (Failed)
Error: Process completed with exit code 8.
```

So here is what I think is happening: The old script (pre 3D grid) simply added additional stuff to a dump file via >> dump.  So if one of the levels had no ountours it simply did not add anything.  Now that the dump file is per contour the fact that it is missing causes the error from gawk.  So I think we simply add a check for this to bypass.  Since it works for macOS it is possibly that the cut just barely misses the volume in Linux and just touches in macOS.  We shall see once the test runs again.  I will fix this after an ongoing zoom...

title: Some new failing tests
